thread.title: Egypt Sees Unstable Weather on Friday | Sada Elbalad
thread.title_full: Egypt Sees Unstable Weather on Friday | Sada Elbalad

title: Egypt Sees Unstable Weather on Friday | Sada Elbalad
text: The Egyptian Meteorological Authority (EMA) predicts the country will see unstable weather conditions on Friday, including heavy rainfall and a slight decline in the temperature. Moderate weather is expected to prevail from the North of the country to North Upper Egypt during the daylight hours. Hot weather is also predicted to hit South Sinai and South Upper Egypt. Wind will be active occasionally across the country. Light to medium rainfall, sometimes thunderous, in the south of Lower Egypt, Canal cities, Northeast Coast, Red Sea mountain trail, and South Sinai. Medium to heavy rain, sometimes thunderous, is also predicted to hit the Northwestern Coast, and north of Lower Egypt. Furthermore, the Mediterranean Sea will experience moderate waves, ranging between 1.5 and 2 meters in height varying between northwest and northeast surface winds. Waves in the Red Sea will be moderate waves, ranging between 1 and 2 meters in height with northwest surface winds. Moderately cold weather is also expected to prevail in Egypt in the early hours and at the end of the nighttime. Light rainfall is also predicted to hit Cairo. Temperatures predicted for the following cities are: 25°C in Cairo, 24°C in Alexandria, 23°C in Marsa Matruh, 27°C in Sohag, 29°C in Qena, and 29°C in Aswan.
